hints.content:
This circle is split into $2$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{halves}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A circle is divided into 2 equal parts. 1 part is shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3a48cece628a8e6085e240a0d535142af292a487)

The circle has **one half** of the shape shaded.

This circle is split into $4$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{fourths}$, with $3$ pieces shaded.  

![A circle is divided into 4 equal parts. 3 parts are shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/82ef24b6ca2fb4a9182fefaa14289c04dd2f6588)

This circle has **three fourths** of the shape shaded.

This circle is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $3$ pieces shaded.  

![A circle is divided into 3 equal parts. 3 parts are shaded gold.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/531c8223ea8f7b07fecb43da09a2e64ad74b9728)

This circle has **three thirds** of the shape shaded.

This circle has **three thirds** of the shape shaded:

![A circle is divided into 3 equal parts. 3 parts are shaded gold.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/531c8223ea8f7b07fecb43da09a2e64ad74b9728)

question.content:
**Which circle shows three thirds of the shape shaded?**

choices.content: ![A circle is divided into 2 equal parts. 1 part is shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3a48cece628a8e6085e240a0d535142af292a487)
![A circle is divided into 3 equal parts. 3 parts are shaded gold.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/531c8223ea8f7b07fecb43da09a2e64ad74b9728)
![A circle is divided into 4 equal parts. 3 parts are shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/82ef24b6ca2fb4a9182fefaa14289c04dd2f6588)
